column1: Tonsillitis is inflammation (swelling) of the tonsils.
A bacterial or viral infection can cause tonsillitis.
Tonsillitis is very common in children.

Common symptoms may be: - Difficulty swallowing - Ear pain - Fever and chills - Headache - Sore throat, which lasts longer than 48 hours and may be severe - Tenderness of the jaw and throat Other problems or symptoms that may occur are: - Problems breathing, if the tonsils are very large - Problems eating or drinking
A rapid strep test can be done in most doctors' offices.
If tests show you do have strep, your doctor will give you antibiotics.
- Take over-the-counter (OTC) medicines, such as acetaminophen (Tylenol) or ibuprofen to reduce pain and fever.
Some people who have repeated infections may need surgery to remove the tonsils (tonsillectomy).
